title: EDGE Group Reveals Arsenal of 11 New Drones and Missiles with Advanced Capabilities
originSummary: EDGE Group, a defense conglomerate in the UAE, has introduced 11 military systems, including a medium-altitude drone capable of carrying 350kg and flying for 24 hours.
The company also displayed tactical drones with AI capabilities, subsonic cruise missiles, guided munitions, and jamming devices.

These systems align with EDGE Group's emphasis on autonomous capabilities, precision-guided munitions, and electronic warfare, and they are expected to be available in the market within the next two years.

title: General Atomics Collaborates with Edge Group to Integrate Al Tariq Weapons into MQ-9B SkyGuardian UAV
originSummary: General Atomics and Edge Group have joined forces to incorporate the Al Tariq family of precision weapons into the SkyGuardian UAV.
The Al Tariq weapons have already been successfully integrated into multiple UAE Air Force platforms.
This partnership aligns with the "Make in the UAE" initiative, emphasizing local manufacturing and development capabilities.

title: BlueHalo to Develop High-Energy Laser Prototype for JLTV in Navy Contract
originSummary: BlueHalo has secured a contract from the U.S. Navy to develop a high-energy laser directed-energy weapon (DEW) prototype for the U.S. Marine Corps' JLTV.
The system, named LOCUST, aims to offer advanced mobile air defense against unmanned aerial system threats.
BlueHalo will collaborate with the Naval Surface Warfare Center to conduct compatibility testing for the prototype integration.

title: UAE firm EDGE Group expands drone and missile portfolio at Dubai Airshow
originSummary: A SAMI executive discusses the company's localization efforts in Saudi Arabia, highlighting their focus on adapting products and services to the local market.
The executive mentions potential business deals in Turkey, indicating SAMI's interest in expanding its operations to new markets.
The executive also shares the company's future plans, demonstrating SAMI's commitment to growth and development.

title: Elistair introduces Khronos, an automated tethered observation UAS for ISR missions
originSummary: Elistair has introduced Khronos, an automated system for intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance (ISR) missions.
Khronos can operate in GPS/GNSS-denied and RF-denied environments and can be deployed quickly with minimal human input.
The system is described as a simple, organic, long-endurance ISR asset and weighs 30.8kg, operating at an altitude of 60m.

title: Exyn Technologies Names Brandon Torres Declet as CEO to Drive Global Expansion of Robotic Autonomy Solutions
originSummary: Exyn Technologies, a company specializing in robotic autonomy for areas without GPS, has named Brandon Torres Declet as its new CEO.
With over 25 years of experience in the drone industry, Declet will be responsible for managing all aspects of Exyn's operations and expanding its geospatial product offerings worldwide.

Declet's previous role as CEO of AgEagle Aerial Systems Inc. and his expertise in establishing partnerships with government agencies and corporations in regulated markets will contribute to Exyn's growth.

title: Lockheed Martin Australia's Agile Shield successfully detects and neutralizes improvised threats in complex battlespace
originSummary: Lockheed Martin Australia's STELaRLab has created Agile Shield, a tactical system designed to detect and neutralize improvised threats in a complex battlespace.
Agile Shield uses sensors and effectors to combat threats like unmanned aerial systems (UAS) and improvised explosive devices.

The system underwent a successful field demonstration at Puckapunyal Military Area to evaluate its effectiveness against small UAS threats, aiming to develop it into a lifesaving capability for military personnel.

title: FCAS: Europe's Ambitious Plan for 6th Generation Fighter Jets and Unmanned Systems
originSummary: The Future Combat Air System (FCAS) program is a collaboration between France, Germany, and Spain to develop a next-generation fighter jet and unmanned aerial systems connected via a combat "cloud."
FCAS is essential for achieving European strategic autonomy and improving the European aerospace industry.
Despite budgetary concerns, Germany remains committed to the FCAS program.
